messages.content: What is the purpose of the LCMSampler-ComfyUI extension node?
The LCMSampler-ComfyUI extension node is designed to use the LCMized LoRA of the [SSD-1B-anime](https://huggingface.co/furusu/SSD-1B-anime) model for generating images.
Is the performance of LCMSampler-ComfyUI guaranteed in the original LCM?
No, the performance of LCMSampler-ComfyUI in the original LCM is not guaranteed, and the current version cannot load weights.
What is the recommended method to use the LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
To use LCMSampler-ComfyUI, one should use a custom sampler-compatible loader instead of the usual KSampler. The sampler should be loaded from 'sampling/custom_sampling/Load SamplerLCM'.
How is TAESD used with LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
TAESD is used as a decoder and can be loaded using 'loader/Load TAESD'. It is expected to function similarly to a VAE. If there is not enough VRAM, users should decrease the max_batch_size.
What resources are needed to be downloaded for LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
To use LCMSampler-ComfyUI, users need to download a model checkpoint and two LoRA files from the provided links in the workflow description.
Where can the source code for Latent Consistency Model (LCM) be found?
The source code for Latent Consistency Model (LCM) can be found at https://github.com/luosiallen/latent-consistency-model.
Which other extension is LCMSampler-ComfyUI based on?
LCMSampler-ComfyUI is based on the ComfyUI-OtherVAEs extension, which can be found at https://github.com/M1kep/ComfyUI-OtherVAEs.
